nodes.name: India
nodes.explanation: India has a population of 1.3 billion and a density of doctors and nurses lower than the WHO threshold.

nodes.name: Health Indicators
nodes.explanation: India's health indicators have improved but continue to lag behind peer nations.

nodes.name: WHO Threshold
nodes.explanation: The WHO threshold is 44.5 doctors, nurses, and midwives per 10,000 population.

nodes.name: Human Resources
nodes.explanation: Human resources have a central role in healthcare but show a paucity in skilled personnel.

nodes.name: Universal Health Coverage
nodes.explanation: Universal health coverage is a goal India must accelerate towards for sustainable development.

nodes.name: National Medical Council
nodes.explanation: The newly minted National Medical Council has opportunities within healthcare to achieve SDGs.

nodes.name: Public Sector
nodes.explanation: The public sector is government-funded and has been underfunded with 1.28% of GDP allocation.

nodes.name: Private Sector
nodes.explanation: The private sector is the dominant provider, perceived to provide quality care and involves booming medical tourism.

nodes.name: Federal Health Budget
nodes.explanation: The increase in the federal health budget is seen as an opportunity for healthcare reforms.

nodes.name: National Health Mission
nodes.explanation: NHM has aimed to increase the quantum of services since its inception in 2005.

nodes.name: Accredited Social Health Activists (ASHA)
nodes.explanation: ASHAs are community health workers serving to extend the reach of Auxiliary Nurse Midwives.

nodes.name: Auxiliary Nurse Midwives (ANM)
nodes.explanation: ANMs are meant to serve a population of 5,000 people but often serve up to 20,000.

nodes.name: Ayushman Bharat
nodes.explanation: Ayushman Bharat is a health insurance scheme designed to allow access to care services.

nodes.name: Digital Technologies
nodes.explanation: Digital technology facilitates healthcare delivery and has been catalyzed by the COVID-19 pandemic.

nodes.name: Telemedicine
nodes.explanation: Telemedicine has amplified the reach of care during the COVID-19 pandemic.

nodes.name: Violence against Healthcare Personnel
nodes.explanation: Increasing incidents of violence against doctors are a worrisome trend.

edges.content: India's density of doctors and nurses per 10,000 persons is much lower than the WHO threshold.
WHO threshold denotes the density required for doctors, nurses, and midwives per 10,000 population in India.
India's health indicators have improved but lag behind those of its peer nations.
The health indicators of India continue to lag behind peer nations despite improvement.
The paucity of skilled personnel in India affects its progress towards universal health coverage and SDGs.
Universal health coverage is a goal that India must accelerate towards for sustainable development.
Human resource issues must be tackled for improving India's healthcare.

The National Medical Council is analyzed alongside the burgeoning private health sector systems.
The burgeoning private sector systems are analyzed along with the National Medical Council.
The growing divide between the public and private health sectors is analyzed.
The divide between the burgeoning private and public health sectors is increasing.
The public sector is seeking to improve India's healthcare provision through NHM.
India's public sector is underfunded but aims to provide healthcare to vulnerable populations.
The private sector perceives opportunities with the federal health budget increase.
The increase in the federal health budget has perceived opportunities in the private sector.
NHM aimed to increase services in the public healthcare sector.
ASHAs are serving to increase the reach of Auxiliary Nurse Midwives.
Auxiliary Nurse Midwives' reach is extended by ASHAs.
Ayushman Bharat aims to provide access to care services and can help meet SDGs.
Universal health coverage includes schemes like Ayushman Bharat to accelerate progress towards SDGs.
Digital technology has facilitated an increase in telemedicine usage.
Telemedicine usage was facilitated by advancements in digital technology.
Violence against healthcare personnel in India hinders healthcare provision efforts.
Incidents of violence against healthcare personnel add stress to India's healthcare challenges.
